headline: Excellent and Healthy Cornbread
description: This healthy cornbread recipe is made with nonfat yogurt in place of oil. It mixes up in minutes and is ready to enjoy after just 20 minutes in the oven.
name: Excellent and Healthy Cornbread

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Lightly grease an 8-inch square baking pan.
Whisk flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking soda, and salt together in a large bowl. Stir in yogurt and eggs until just combined; do not overmix. Pour batter into the prepared pan.
Bake in the preheated oven until the center springs back when lightly pressed, 20 to 25 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Good - a little spongy but simple, healthy and tasty so I will make again
Simply and uses pantry staples but this turned out well! Crispy outside and soft inside. I added orange zest just to add some dimension.

I made this with Mexican corn meal. I also substituted low fat ricotta (1/2 cup) with 1/2 cup of non-fat milk. Came out coarse. I added a few (1/4 teaspoon) chile flakes, which added some flavor. The recipe doesn't make that much, say half a typical loaf pan height. The flavor was okay. Some honey improved the serving.

The taste was okay, but the texture was really off-putting! It came out sponge-like. We dubbed it “breadgurt,” and will never be making it again. Had to swallow it down with bites of soup. It smelled like yogurt too. No idea why this recipe is so highly rated. The low sugar content was nice, but not worth the outcome.
I didn’t care for this recipe. The texture was off—it tasted more like a quick read rather than cornbread.
it's moist and delicious! I used chobani greek yogurt. I only had to cook it for 20 minutes.
I used White Mountain Bulgarian Yogurt. It is a very tart and almost runny yogurt. My cornbread was very moist and had a great flavor.
This is an awesome recipe!! Not too sweet, heart healthy.

"We made it for Thanksgiving tomorrow and tasted some. We really like it and don't know if we can save it for tomorrow!" - my daughter, age 7
Note: made as is but added 1/4 cup honey.

This is the worst cornbread I have ever tried. Followed the recipe exactly and it was so thick I couldn't even stir, so I added about 1/4 cup milk. Put in the oven at 400 degrees for 23 minutes and it was runny in the middle! Put it back in for about 10 more minutes. Completely bland. Will not make again. Rather, will be sticking to my usual unhealthy cornbread with buttermilk and butter!

This is the only cornbread recipe I'll use from now on. Note that the cooking time was 15 minutes in a well-preheated oven. This is delicious and moist, not greasy like some recipes. I used stevia in place of sugar and the corn completely masked the odd flavor of the stevia. This cornbread is more flavorful than "sweet" so don't let the 1/4 cup of sugar put you off if you like a non-sweet version.
Turned out beautiful... but is very bland, dry, and tough. Followed the recipe to the letter. Both my son and I didn't like it. I threw the entire thing in the backyard for the birds.

I used greek yogart and had to add probably 1/2 cup of skim milk. Without the milk it was a dry dough than a batter. Even after the milk I still had to spread it into the pan with a spatula. I also used a preheated cast iron skillet with olive oil in the bottom. This gave it a nice crispy bottom crust. Cooking took closer to 15 minutes than 20 minutes. It turned out really well and has a very pleasant texture. It's not crumbly at all and holds together really well.
Very quick to make and delicious ! Thanks for a great recipe.

Make sure the pan is greased well-I just used cooking spray and it stuck more than I’d like. Other than that is was SUPER FAST, and SUPER DELICIOUS! I love the grittiness of the cornmeal unlike the boxed cornbread mix.
Did not have yogurt used sour cream instead.

This is a dense cornbread and not sweet. I saw the comments about adding honey but opted to just add 1 tablespoon which is not enough if you are used to sweet cornbread. Acgood recipe that I will make again. These muffins baked in 15 minutes in my oven. Next time I will lower temperature to 375 degrees.

This is a dense cornbread and not sweet. I saw the comments about adding honey but opted to just add 1 tablespoon which is not enough if you are used to sweet cornbread. Acgood recipe that I will make again. These muffins baked in 15 minutes in my oven. Next time I will lower temperature to 375 degrees.
I have made thiis twice now and I didn't change a thing. It is delicious as it is.
Quick to make and as good as any cornbread recipe I've made before.
I live in Colorado. It needed a half cup water. I used Greek yogurt. I cooked it in an iron skillet that was coated with olive oil. It turned out perfectly.
Great recipe, I used butter milk instead of yogurt, it was very good!

By itself it’s kind of dry and tasteless. But it’s a great idea to use the yogurt and a lot less sugar. I will try the suggestion to add 1/4 cup of honey next time and maybe even the one tablespoon of oil.
I am in love with this recipe!!! These were so easy to make and super moist and sweet! I didn’t change a thing! 5 stars!
It turned out really good. I will be making this recipe again in the future!
This is delicious!!
Very easy and clean tasting. Perfect for family nights.

I used whole fat yogurt 1/4 almond milk and reduced sugar by since the almond milk has a little sugar and I wanted to add some honey. I refer my cornbread not sweet and to eat with salted butter. Came out moist and everyone LOVED it. Will make again.
I had to add a half of cup of milk. Most likely because I used whole wheat flour instead of white. Bread turned ouy great.

This recipe is missing some kind of liquid. I made it but I could not mix it because it was so dry. Total mess. I went ahead with baking thinking a miracle would happen. It did not. Something is missing. Had to throw it out.
I followed the recipe exactly and it was excellent!

I switched the sugar and used erithritol sugar substitute and added 1/2 cup of almond milk. The bread rose and was nice and spongy, not very sweet. Good compliment to spicy chili and only 2 WW points per muffin.
I made this recipe to go with homemade tomato soup. It was moist and delicious and so much healthier that some recipes.
We have made this recipe several times and my family LOVES it. My 9yr old os our Baker that has made this a family favorite. #homeschoolbaker

I think it turned out good! I added 1 tablespoon of honey to sweeten slightly but next time I might add one or two more. Think I over cooked it for a couple of minutes because it is pretty brown and slightly dryer than I would have liked, might add a little coconut oil next time to see if that will help. Overall, for a healthier cornbread, I thought if was very good. Great with some butter.
Not much flavor so I ate it with lots of butter, kind of defeats the ‘no oil’ thing. Will look for a different rcipe.
Fantastic!!! Fyi, use fine ground corn meal, has a better mouth feel then stone ground corn meal, it's too coarse.

I took the advice of recent reviews and added a couple of tablespoons of honey and vegetable oil plus a little less sugar, and added some milk to make the mixture stirrable. This cornbread was devoured by the family within 30 minutes - delicious, not too sweet and very good with chili!

I made as directed. This was so good-I can’t believe it’s only 100 calories per piece. As a side note, the batter is really thick - I had to press it into the pan. I thought I did something wrong, but it came out perfect.

I was pleasantly surprised at how good this was - moist, with great texture. I added a slug of honey and a drizzle of vegetable oil to the yogurt before mixing it in to the dry ingredients. I replaced the sugar with granulated Swerve. 

I don't know if it had any impact on the outcome, but I made the batter a few hours before baking, and put it in the fridge until a half-hour before it went in the oven.

I made this and recognized pretty quickly that this needs milk added or it will come out too dry I added about 3/4 cup of almond milk. I also used brown sugar, vanilla flavored Greek yogurt. It came out pretty well. Next time I plan to add less flour 
and more cornmeal like a 1/4 cup swap of each. I read comments after mine was in the oven and saw others have added almond milk as well. Not sure if it is an ommission in the recipe, but definitely add milk.
Our new family favorite!!
Very good, added 2 T honey and 1 T of oil as suggested by others.
Did not like this at all... I’ll not make it again. It was dry and had an odd taste to it.
I add canned corn and put honey butter on top
Note to self...don't repeat this.
This is so tasty and I love that there's no oil in it. I didn't have any yogurt so I replaced that with buttermilk and added frozen roasted corn kernels from Trader Joe's. Delicious!
Easy to make and so good. I added two Tbsp of honey.

substituted 1/2 cup whole wheat flour for the white; Added a Tbsp. flaxseed meal....used some of the sugar, but also subbed in about a Tbsp. honey and a teaspoon of vanilla. Also added a half Tbsp. canola oil. All of these made the recipe moist and hopefully a little healthy with the WW flour and flaxseed meal. Baked them as muffins, so lowered the heat to 375 and baked for 17 minutes. They're just right for a dinner muffin with pulled pork or a breakfast muffin...not too sweet, but sweet enough; nice tender crumb and moist!

I am on a low fat diet. This is amazing. I have made cornbread the traditional way for my family in the past. They raved about it then I told them that I used no fat plain yogurt. Both wanted recipe. Had to bake 10 minutes longer.
A great tasting good corn bread. Freezes well.
I liked the texture, which was moist and dense. Even better with a touch of honey.
I made some changes as I'm Gluten Free. Substituted oat flour for the AP flour, and swapped maple syrup for the sugar. Came out great.

I made this recipe exactly as said and it was bland, dry, and overcooked by 16 minutes. Next time I will try adding honey and cooking for less time. Or even better idea- just find a new recipe. Annoying, though. I was happy to find a healthy and sour cream free (I think sour cream cornbread is gross) recipe. I just wish it was tastier.
The taste was amazing! This is definitely a keeper! I added about a tablespoon of almond milk because the mixture was a little thick. Next time I will add honey. Overall, great taste!

Was better than expected for "healthy" cornbread. I made it as recipe listed plus a splash of honey (as some people noted). I put it in the oven for 20min and checked in on it at 18min and it was already getting a tad dark on the top. It still tasted great, just a little dry. I will probably add a little more yogurt, or a splash of oil next time; and keep a closer eye on it while cooking. But definitely recommend it and will be making it again.
This was really good! Used erythitol and a little honey for sweetness. Used white whole wheat flour.

Excellent! I took a chance and used vanilla nonfat yogurt. It turned out very well. Based on other reviews, I added 1/4 cup honey and am pleased with the slight sweetness in the final result. Fyi, the way I made it is about 150 calories per slice, compared to 225+ from other recipes. Very pleased.
Followed exactly except used Stevia instead of sugar and I love it! Best low-fat guiltless cornbread recipe I have found!

Made this using a muffin pan instead of a loaf pan. Reduce the baking time down to 7-10 minutes. Yield is 12 muffins.

Additionally I made the following substitutions:

Replace the 1/4 cup sugar with honey
I used plain nonfat greek yogurt and increased the amount by 1/4 cup to 1 and 1/4 cups yogurt.

Also, if you'd like an additional kick, add 1/2 - 1 whole jalapeño diced to the batter depending upon taste.

I substituted 1/2 cup whole wheat flour for half of the white, used unsweetened almond milk instead of yogurt, replaced the sugar with Splenda and poured it into a hot, oiled cast iron skillet to give it a nice chewy, crispie crust. Baked it only 18 minutes and it was great. My husband never asks me for anything because he doesn't want me in the kitchen late into the evening. But this is one recipe that he will ask for. So I will continue to used this recipe. NOTE: For the hot skillet trick, I put a tablespoon or so of olive oil in my cast iron skillet and slide it into the oven while it's preheating and I'm mixing the batter together. When my batter is ready, I pour it directly into the hot skillet. It should sizzle when you do this! Makes for a great texture.
This came out great! I substituted half of the flour with whole wheat flour and substituted the sugar with honey. Fluffy, not sweet, perfect, and a bit healthier!

I love this recipe. Since I am diabetic, I must watch sugar intake. I make another recipe from a diabetic cookbook, but so many steps. Recipe got my eye, because it was made with yogurt (which I make my own to control sugars and preservatives). I took suggestions from other reviewers and added couple items as well: 2 tablespoons honey and applesauce; as well as, 1/2 teaspoon baking powder. Next time I might add 1 teaspoon vanilla. Also not sure if other reviewers meant white whole wheat or whole wheat so I made it with 1/2 cup white whole wheat and 1/2 cup white flour. Cornbread was not dry at all. Also I baked at 400 and crust was too brown, and not quite done inside. It could be my countertop oven, but next time will turn down to 350 and bake longer -- possibly 25 -30 mins, or until done. 

But I will make it again -- very, very tasty and so easy to make. Great with chili, or just as desert after dinner with homemade fruit spread.

I made this with Greek yogurt and the batter came out really thick. I didn't have any milk, so I added water until the consistency was right. The finished muffins had good flavor, but the texture was pretty muffin-like, rather than crumbly and cornbread-like. It was a great accompaniment for chili, though, and it did taste pretty good. I would definitely try it again with plain yogurt or by adding some milk with the Greek yogurt.

I wanted to find a good recipe without using buttermilk or cream and ended up finding this one. This recipe is easy and bakes really quickly and evenly. I made it with no sugar at all and it tasted great. Also I've made it multiple times and every time it has tasted great. Reheat it in the toaster oven or oven.

Good texture and flavor. Just not sweet enough for my taste. My family prefers the "golden sweet cornbread", also on this site. This one is the runner up. But, I will make it again with tad more sugar.

This is my first time making this. I used all-purpose flour and white cornmeal. It came out great and it was delicious. My Husband even loved it. We've never had anything like it. We both ate two slices. I'll be using this recipe from now on.

I like this quite a lot and have made it about five times. I cut back the sugar and add a couple of tablespoons of honey. I usually add a small can of salt-free corn, and some vanilla extract. I like the texture and the fact that it is relatively healthy. I'm going to keep making this one.

I used sour cream instead of yogurt and found the batter to be exceedingly dry -- actually, it wasn't even pourable. I added some milk to thin it out. No, it does not taste exactly like cornbread made with oil or butter, but it was quite tasty all the same.
This bread was extremely dense. Wasn't nice and crumby and 0 sweetness to it.
it was very quick and simple to make. I liked how moist they were
Very dry and not flavorful.

My first time ever making cornbread...definitely won't be the last! I added a quarter cup of milk and 1 tbsp of oil as I used greek yoghurt as recommended by another commentator. I used whole wheat flour to make it even healthier. Came out great. Thank you very much for this recipe, it's definitely going in the "keeper" folder. :)
Great recipe! I didn't have plain yogurt on hand so I just used whipping cream instead. I also made them into muffins and baked them for 15 minutes. They were delicious!!

I used a large muffin baking pans
I substituted and used Greek yogurt,
I added 1 cup mocha mix . 
Honey,and put cut a piece of cheddar in the center of each muffin.
The result was a creamy light muffin you can scream about!

This is a wonderful cornbread recipe that is easy to make and lower in calories than the cornbread made with butter. I have made it a few times now using low fat vanilla yogurt. I have cooked it in a loaf pan as well as made muffins, though of course you must decrease the cooking time when making muffins. Serve with butter, margarine or honey butter. Delicious!
The mixture was dry and the bread came out like rocks.
I am actually quite surprised at how well this turned out. I added a bit of milk and honey to my batter as it was really thick, almost like dough.
All good. Added honey, probably 1/4 cup. Needed a little more moisture still. Would make again!
I added a small can of niblet corn drained. I served it with creamy tuna and it was delicious.

This is good and healthy. The only type of yogurt i had was Greek and like another reviewer said, it's too dense with just the Greek yogurt. Next time, I'll add some milk, maybe a tbsp of oil or if planning ahead, get the regular yogurt. The amount of sugar was fine. The recipe was super easy, too, I probably made it in 5 minutes.
Love this recipe!! I've made it several times and it is so good.

Texture and taste was excellent with a light brown crust. I needed a recipe that used plain greek yogurt not milk so it was perfect but since I didn't need low fat, I used a tablespoon of canola oil. I think cornbread needs oil but will try it next time without. Very good with my turnip greens. will make again!

Amazing! I made it into muffins instead, and they turned out wonderfully. Be careful not to overcook. The muffins were done in just ten minutes! I feel like it is missing something but am not an experienced cook, so I couldn't tell you what that would be. I will definitely make this recipe again!
I added crumbled turkey bacon and sliced jalapeño peppers to give it an added kick. It turned out so moist and delicious!

This was so delicious! I did make a few changes because mine was too thick. I used 1/2 c. white flour and 1/2 c. wheat flour and also added two Tbsp of milk, 1 Tbsp grapeseed oil, and a little non-sweetened apple sauce. I also skipped the sugar and added two packets of stevia because I don't like really sweet cornbread. It was moist yet crumbly. Next time I will add the canned corn and some green chilis or jalepenos for spice! This was perfect four soup and chili and I will make it 100 more times!
This is my go-to recipe for cornbread when I'm making chili. No guilt. Dry enough to sop up sauces, moist enough to have a pleasant texture. So easy. I love simple recipes that taste good.

I was looking for a low fat cornbread recipe , found this recipe and was a little skeptical at the beginning to try it. I gave it a shot anyways . I made muffins instead of the bread ( need to get a cake pan soon )To my surprise this was a total hit! I added Jalepenos for the spice and everyone at home loved it . Made more for a dinner party we were attending and they were gone in a minute . Everyone loved it .

Definitely a keeper!!
I found the cornbread a little tasteless and not the right texture. I don't think I would ever try it again.

The first time I made this recipe the batter was ridiculously thick and the cornbread came out dry. I realized after it was because I used greek yogurt instead of non-fat which is my preference. The second time I made it was MUCH more successful with these small changes: Greek yogurt instead of regular non-fat, replace the sugar with 2 TBSP of raw honey, add 1/4 cup low-fat milk and 1 TBSP of melted butter to help thin the batter. I also added 1/2 cup sweet corn. Delicious!
I used a combo of kefir and greek yogurt. I also used egg replacer. This bread was delicious!!! I did individual mini loaves and baked for 20 mins. Rose well, good texture, really great taste.
Delicious n healthy bread. Try it!

I've made this twice now. The first time the muffins were ok but not great. I added 2 T. oil and 1 T. milk the second time I made them. That made them more to my taste. All in all this is a good recipe thanks for sharing.

This was the best cornbread recipe I have ever made ! It did not stick to the pan, and was very moist , despite no oil added.It was excellent! If you don't like sweet cornbread you could leave out or cut back on the sugar. I used Splenda Blend in mine and we loved it!
First time I made corn muffins, used this recipe and it worked well
I LOVED this recipe! I'm a Southern girl born and bred and it makes me so happy that I got such an authentic taste from ingredients I can get here in the UK.
This cornbread was moist, delicious, and so easy. I am a convert, after using the same recipe for many years, this will now be my go to! Thanks.

Made it for a chili cook off, everyone loved it! Added a small can of corn to the mix for texture. Make it healthier by subbing a couple scoops of steiva for the sugar, & 1/2C of wheat bran or flax meal for 1/2C of the white flour.

Just made a batch and tweaked it a bit. No sugar, but used stevia and a bit of raw honey. Added a bit of organic half-n-half and a cup of frozen organic corn. Must say, it's awesome while it's hot, with a dollop of softened butter. YUM!
